title: Trimestre 1 Review & Final Project Proposal
description: Comprehensive review of administrative vocabulary and advanced grammar from Weeks 1-11.

items.explanation: Mediation is the process of a neutral third party helping resolve a conflict.
items.prompt: Which term refers to the process of a neutral party helping to resolve a workplace dispute?

items.explanation: Mixed Conditional (Past hypothetical action -> Present result).
items.prompt: If we ________ (hire) the new assistant last month, we ________ (not / be) so overwhelmed with paperwork now.

items.explanation: The Executive Summary provides a high-level overview of a proposal.
items.prompt: Which part of a project proposal provides a concise overview of the entire plan?
By the time the project ends in December, we ________ (achieve) all our initial objectives.

items.explanation: Non-defining relative clause providing extra information about a thing ('the proposal').
items.prompt: The new proposal, ________ was drafted by the Ops team, focuses on streamlining workflows.
If the manager ________ (consult) the team, they ________ (not / resist) the change so strongly.
answers: had consulted / would not have resisted

items.explanation: 'Can't have' expresses certainty that a past event did not occur.
items.prompt: Which modal expresses certainty that something DID NOT happen in the past?

items.explanation: Future Continuous for ongoing future actions.
items.prompt: This time tomorrow, I ________ (present) my project proposal to the board.

items.explanation: Buy-in is the support and agreement needed for a change to succeed.
items.prompt: What is the term for obtaining support and agreement for a proposed change?

items.explanation: To follow up means to contact again.
items.prompt: Don't forget to ________ ________ with the stakeholders after the meeting to confirm the next steps.
